title: Straight Arrow News - SAN - Unbiased. Straight Facts.
text: Latest news - - Why a low-flying radiation helicopter is circling the San Francisco Bay - Trader Joe’s now No. 1 in grocery store satisfaction. Here’s why - Pennsylvania considers castrating child sex offenders. Several states already do - The Washington Post announces significant layoffs, department closures - Ransom note in Guthrie case demands millions in Bitcoin as blood found at home - Did a renowned hacker help Jeffrey Epstein get ‘dirt on other people’? - Trump doubles down on ‘nationalize elections’ call after White House walk-back - Texas man sues California doctor for wrongful death for mailing abortion pills - US hospitals report broad infection declines, safer outcomes in the NICU - Trump demands $1 billion from Harvard, says university is ‘behaving very badly’ - House ends contempt of Congress vote after Clintons agree to Epstein testimony Top stories SAN Originals - Walz, Ellison to testify on Minnesota fraud in March 15% left coverage65% right coverage - New ICE memo gives officers more leeway to conduct warrantless arrests 62% left coverage18% right coverage Powered by Ground News™ Get the facts US Epstein exposed Get the facts Media Miss - ‘My friends will get hurt’: Trump yelled at Greene over Epstein files 80% left coverage0% right coverage - Jeffrey Epstein texted Rep. Stacey Plaskett during Michael Cohen’s congressional hearing: Report 13% left coverage58% right coverage Most Popular - Judge signals trouble for Pentagon case targeting Sen. Mark Kelly - The Washington Post announces significant layoffs, department closures - Ransom note, blood found in Guthrie case; Trump signs shutdown deal - Did a renowned hacker help Jeffrey Epstein get ‘dirt on other people’? - Trump doubles down on ‘nationalize elections’ call after White House walk-back Politics - Judge signals trouble for Pentagon case targeting Sen. Mark Kelly - 700 immigration officers leaving Minnesota, but enforcement surge continues - Trump doubles down on ‘nationalize elections’ call after White House walk-back - Federal judge blocks termination of temporary protected status for Haitian immigrants - House approves funding package to end partial government shutdown U.S. - Is San Francisco’s ‘March for Billionaires’ for real? Details invite skepticism - Attempted Trump assassin Ryan Routh sentenced to life in prison - Why a low-flying radiation helicopter is circling the San Francisco Bay - Pennsylvania considers castrating child sex offenders. Several states already do - The Washington Post announces significant layoffs, department closures - Ransom note in Guthrie case demands millions in Bitcoin as blood found at home - Ransom note, blood found in Guthrie case; Trump signs shutdown deal - Trump’s desire to ‘nationalize’ voting alarms election security experts - Trump demands $1 billion from Harvard, says university is ‘behaving very badly’ Business - Trader Joe’s now No. 1 in grocery store satisfaction. Here’s why - Starbucks touts turnaround in latest fiscal results - Amazon cuts 16,000 corporate jobs amid efforts to develop AI - ‘Save the Post’: Staff plead with Bezos to protect The Washington Post from cuts - Trump wants $5 billion from JPMorgan Chase in ‘political’ debanking lawsuit Tech - Did a renowned hacker help Jeffrey Epstein get ‘dirt on other people’? - Police raid X offices in Paris amid criminal probe - States rush to deny AI personhood amid growing fight over who should regulate - Jeffrey Epstein wanted to hire ‘top hacker.’ What was he looking for? - Is Minneapolis under surveillance during ICE surge? We went there to find out Lifestyle - Is the era of the all-powerful real estate agent over? - Majority of books in Amazon’s ‘Success’ self-help genre likely written by AI : Study - ‘Home Alone,’ ‘Schitt’s Creek’ star Catherine O’Hara dead at 71 - Americans volunteering more blood, sweat and time but not money: Poll - In 2025, Americans ‘detoxed’ from social media. In 2026, they’re quitting altogether Sports - Colleges use tax advantages to lure top athletes in the NIL era - College players among those charged in point-shaving scheme - College Football Playoff semifinals set: Miami vs. Ole Miss, Oregon vs. Indiana - The ‘travel team trap’ that’s sapping parents’ time and bank accounts - A TBI retired his football dreams at 15. Inside youth sports’ pervasive problem Military - USS Abraham Lincoln reaches striking distance of Iran - Flag removal at US Embassy deepens rift with key NATO ally Denmark - Trump warns Iran of ‘speed and violence’ as CENTCOM launches air drills - NATO chief says Europe is ‘dreaming’ if it thinks it can defend itself without US - Tehran warns of ‘painful’ response as US fleet arrives in region International - Ex-Prince Andrew moves out of longtime home amid new Epstein files allegations - US attack on Iran would cause ‘regional war,’ Khamenei says - Zelenskyy says trilateral talks set for next week as deadly drone strike kills 15 - At least 30 Palestinians killed in Israeli strikes as ceasefire tensions rise - International extortion gangs have Canadians calling for national emergency Energy - Why five judges rejected Trump’s arguments against offshore wind farms - To build nuclear faster, energy dept. pitches bypassing environmental laws - How two big changes make Venezuelan oil more open to US investors - Wisconsin electric rates in focus as Microsoft plans 15 new data centers - The Texas grid froze 5 years ago. Is it ready for this weekend’s winter storm? Health - Texas man sues California doctor for wrongful death for mailing abortion pills - US hospitals report broad infection declines, safer outcomes in the NICU - Drug company discontinues next-gen flu vaccine development as flu cases rise - Cancer deaths are declining for those under 50 — except for colorectal cancer - Your sleep tracker isn’t judging you — but it’s not diagnosing you either
